title: Tools
content:
Tools in Baldur's Gate 3 are items that can help a player do something they wouldn't otherwise be able to do, they are not tied to a specific ability. Tools are usually obtained through exploration, looting around from certain areas, killing Enemies, or given by NPCs.

Tools Information

BALDUR'S GATE 3 TOOLS COMPARISON TABLE

You can search by Name, Description or Effects. Just type into the search box what you are looking for.

Quick Search of All Tools

Name Description Effects Backpack A simple canvas bag, perfect for carrying almost anything Effect goes here Camp Supply Sack Small compartments line the sack; a compass-sized furrow; a pocket packed with storing salts; and an area for stuff tent legs. fixing pegs, and folded canvas Stores your camp supplies. Alchemy Pouch A patina of puce alchemical matter coats this pouch- hopefully not the former owner reduced to dust by thei experiments. Stores your ingredients and extracts. Hammer The varnish of this hammer's handle has been worn dull by hands Effect goes here Thieves' Tools In the right hands, these tools of the burglary trade will make quick work of any troublesome locks. Thieve' Tools enable the owner to open locks based on their Sleight of Hand skill. Thieves' Tools are destroyed on failed use. Tongs These tongs are fire-scorched and pitted with rust. Effect goes here Trap Disarm Toolkit A collection of hooks, blades, shears, and everything else needed to deal with potentially deadly traps. This kit enables the owner to disarm traps/ based on. their Sleight of Hand skill. Shovel Tool Dirt-covered hands have left the grain in this shovel's wooden handle stained black. Use to dig up buried stuff, like the dog collar in Underdark. Disguise Kit A case containing makeup, prosthetics, and wigs - tools for concealing one's identity, or adopting someone else's. Enables the user to choose from two different body types for each race, altering their appearance. This item is used up and the disguise remains in effect until the user takes a long rest or dispels it. Fishing Rod Rusted and slick with grime. The lure may be more valuable than the rod itself. ??
